body:
Comment 2: 
The problem occurs when trying to parse JSON that I have no control over (that is
generated by a third party).  For example, I believe that this is a valid JSON string:
`{ "A Field":9, "Another-Field":10 }`

However if you run the program below, you get the output `&main.MyStruct{AField:0,
AnotherField:10}` (notice the value for AField is not set).

package main

import (
	"json"
	"fmt"
	"bytes"
)

type MyStruct struct {
	AField int `json:"A Field"`
	AnotherField int `json:"Another-Field"`
}

var jsonText = `{ "A Field":9, "Another-Field":10 }`

func main() {
	decoder := json.NewDecoder(bytes.NewBufferString(jsonText))
	var m MyStruct
	decoder.Decode(&m)
	fmt.Printf("%#v", &m)
}
